data.text:
Junior Guard Program Spotlight: Miami Beach Ocean Rescue, FL Miami Beach Ocean Rescue’s Junior Lifeguard Program was established seven years ago, with the goal of educating the youth of the greater Miami area about beach and ocean safety. The program runs for two weeks each summer, the first week for ages 8-10 and the second ages 11-13. Participants are taught the role of lifeguards, basic rescue skills such as a rescue board rescue, and first aid. The program incorporates plenty of fun as well such as paddle boarding, surfing small waves, and even a dedicated personal rescue watercraft day. MBOR believes that the Junior Lifeguard Program is very important to their community and neighbors since the ocean is their “backyard”, and they are surrounded by water ways. They encourage participants to attend swimming lessons to further develop their swimming skills. #usla #lifeguardsforlife

Open water lifeguards are often the first to respond in critical situations, yet they are not officially recognized as first responders. In partnership with FOX's new drama series, #RescueHISurf, we're working to change this. Voice your support to Congress by visiting RHSFirstResponders.com. If you’re in the area, join us at Seaside Heights on Saturday, August 24, to discuss the cause and enjoy a sweet treat. Your support truly makes a difference! Catch the drama and dedication of lifeguards on #RescueHISurf, premiering this fall on FOX. #LifeguardsFirst #SupportHCR41 #USLA

Congratulations to first-time National Champions Sussex County (DE), who overwhelmed and dominated the competition. LA County finished in second place, while last year’s champions Monmouth County took third. We’d like to extend a sincere thank you to this year’s sponsors: Jersey Mike’s, Hobie Eyewear, Engine Swim, DaFin, Isla Grand South Padre, and Visit South Padre Island. We’d also like to thank your dedicated volunteers and officials for their tireless efforts throughout the weekend, as well as Padre Beach Rescue Association for hosting this year’s event. Stay tuned to official USLA channels for 2025 USLA National Championships location and date announcements. #usla #lifeguardsforlife

Agency Spotlight: Town of Orleans – Nauset Beach, MA Nauset Beach, located in the town of Orleans, Massachusetts and the first guarded surf beach as you follow the eastern coast of Cape Cod, has been staffed with lifeguards for over 60 years and has been USLA certified since 2013. Lifeguards and other beach services, such as park rangers, are fully funded through beach parking fees. Nauset Beach starts their season with tryouts every year in June, followed by a week of Surf Rescue School. Their staff of 25 is led by Chief Lifeguard Tom Miskiv, a retired Air Force Master Sergeant and FireFighter/Lieutenant for COMM Fire. Assisting Tom are two talented individuals and lead Captains, Sarah Newcomb-Baker and Christen Fiero, both of whom showcased their skills as competitors in the 2023 USLA Nationals. NB Lifeguards are well-equipped to handle various emergencies, ensuring beach safety until their season concludes with Labor Day Weekend. In addition to traditional lifeguard duties, the team at Nauset Beach actively collaborates with the Atlantic White Shark Conservancy to protect the public from the increasing White Shark population in the area. Utilizing technology like the Sharktivity App, the team stays vigilant and ready to respond to any potential threats, ensuring visitor safety. Moreover, Nauset Beach is committed to community engagement and education. Collaborating with the Orleans Recreation Department and supporting local non-profits such as the Cape Cod National Seashore Alumni Association and the Nauset Beach Lifeguard Alumni Associate, Inc., the beach fosters a sense of environmental stewardship and community involvement. Nauset Beach lifeguards host an annual lifeguard competition open to all lifeguard agencies in the New England Region called the SandShark Relays. Nauset Beach serves as not just a recreational destination but also a beacon of safety, community engagement, and environmental conservation, making it a cherished and valuable asset to the Town of Orleans and Cape Cod as a whole. View a full list of USLA certified agencies at USLA.org/certified. #usla #lifeguardsforlife

August 17th is officially recognized as National Nonprofit Day, a chance to celebrate nonprofit organizations and their ongoing efforts to serve their communities. The United States Lifesaving Association is America’s nonprofit, professional association of beach lifeguards and open water rescuers. We work to reduce the incidence of death and injury in the aquatic environment through public education, national lifeguard standards, training programs, promotion of high levels of lifeguard readiness, and other means. Please consider supporting the USLA by making a direct online donation to help fund our ongoing efforts. Visit USLA.org/donate to learn more about where you can direct your donation. We thank you for considering us! #usla #lifeguardsforlife

Hurricane season has officially begun in the Atlantic region of the United States, and will peak in early September. NOAA is predicting above average hurricane activity for 2024, with most activity typically occurring between mid-August and mid-October. Even when hurricanes don’t produce a direct hit to an area or stay out at sea, they can still cause dangerous ocean conditions such as: large surf, heightened rip current activity, above average tides and storm surges. As always, the USLA reminds the public: SWIM NEAR A LIFEGUARD. When you arrive at the beach, check with lifeguards for designated swim areas and their safety advice. There may be hazards and temporary restrictions in effect. And also, lifeguards: no matter your region or location, thank you for your continued efforts to keep the swimming public safe. #usla #lifeguardsforlife

Today was the last day of the Jersey Mike's Subs USLA National Lifeguard Championships in South Padre Island, TX. Competitors from around the nation worked hard all week, testing their skills in events in the ocean and on the sand designed to promote camaraderie among competitors, coaches, and families in attendance. Thank you to all those who participated in the week’s events for your hard work and determination, and congratulations to the 2024 National Champions Sussex County, (DE). Look forward to our official recap post with results coming soon. All Championship information, including results, will be posted at USLA.org/nationals. Photography by: Leal Media #usla #lifeguardsforlife

Did you know that despite being the first line of defense in life-threatening ocean rescues, most open-water lifeguards in the U.S. are not recognized as first responders? It’s time to change that. In partnership with the USLA for the “LIFEGUARDS FIRST” campaign, FOX’s new drama series #RescueHISurf highlights the heroic actions of lifeguards who patrol and protect life at sea. Together, we are supporting the “LIFEGUARDS FIRST” campaign. This important letter-writing initiative aims to grant open-water lifeguards the benefits and recognition of Emergency First Responders. Take a stand today! Visit RHSFirstResponders.com and let your voice be heard. Your support can ensure that lifeguards receive the same recognition and benefits as their counterparts in police, fire, and EMS services. Share this message and spread the word. Every letter counts in our mission to secure the benefits and recognition that lifeguards deserve. And once the hard work is done, relax and tune into the premiere of #RescueHISurf on September 22 on @foxtv to see the thrilling lives of lifeguards portrayed like never before! #LifeguardsFirst #SupportHCR41 #USLA

Competitors brought their all on day two of the Jersey Mike's USLA National Lifeguard Championships in South Padre Island, TX. There were many heats, but we also had the finals of the Men’s and Women’s Run-Swim-Run and Paddle Board relay. Congratulations to the following athletes on becoming the 2024 National Champions after a long day of racing: Run-Swim-Run Men’s: Alexander Cole Women’s: Claire Kelly Paddle Board Relay: Men’s: Brian Murphy, Lukas Pohlman, Patrick Jacobson Women’s: Casey Francis, Gwen Bencie, Shannon Snell Reminder: to livestream the event, download the Rio Sports Live Network (RSLN) app or check out riosportslive.com. Trouble with the direct link? We’ve got you covered at USLA.org/nationals. Good luck to all of the competitors in the coming two days! Photography: Gary Quesenberry #usla #lifeguardsforlife #uslanationals2024
